Yondu’s Ghost, appearing: “I’m Mary Poppins, y’all!”

title: Promises of Tomorrow
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2Ip3zvM

by PinkEasterEggs

Posters of Star Wars were dotted around and there were multiple LEGO sets littered on the floor. Clothes were left lying around, some thrown on the back of the chair and some on the carpet. There was a collection of paper and books on the wooden desk, each large volume for a different school subject.

All in all, Steve would’ve said that the room belonged to a kid. The obvious youth that dominated the area confused Steve as he walked into the room further.

A loud blaring sound echoed through Steve’s air, FRIDAY’s dominating voice cutting into the air. “You are not permitted to enter this room Captain Rogers.”

Steve jumped out of the room like the floor was on fire, his confusion only growing. “Whose room is that FRIDAY?”

“Boss has not permitted me to answer that question.”

Was Tony hiding a secret kid?

The Rogue Avengers have been pardoned, returning home for the first time after a year and a half on the run. Steve expects for things to be the same as how he left but it seems that everything has changed. Apparently Tony now had a kid.

question: more tony smuttttttt pls a bitch is thirsty
answer:
oooO  this is FUCKED UP

At night – the Compound is filled with haunts and broken shadows – memories trapped like fairweather ghosts in the corridors and bedrooms. When Tony closes his eyes, he sees nothing but, smoke belched sky and portals – giant sucking mouths pulsing with gold beams and there is dust in his throat.

It chokes him – all that dust – gets trapped in his nostrils and under his tongue. He can’t breathe or think or cry and he wakes up with the sheets soaked in his own cold sweat.

He dreams of you again and again – sees you stretched out in front of them with the ominous horde at your back. The long, rusted blade in Thanos’s grip and you smiling at him.

It’s okay. It’s fine. It’s so so fine.

Thanos smiles at him, too.

She’s yours is she not? She’s yours and you took too many things from me for me to let this go.

The blade falls – it always falls and you fall with it or the pieces of you fall with it in a mess of blood and flesh. The clean slim cut of the gaping neck wound and you still smiling but, your eyes are open and listless.

Tony retches into the dirt – gags up bile and sour stomach acid. 

He dies a little. He’s died every day since.

“Baby?” You walk into his bedroom, long hair sticking up at odd angles and wearing your favorite silk pajamas. “Are you okay?”

He wants to chastise you – tell you it’s not right for you to call him that.

The team can’t know. They can’t know what you are to me and I to you.

But, he doesn’t. Instead, he offers you a tired, half-hearted grin, reaches his hand out and then you descend upon him. The smooth, dry touch of your palm on his cheek, the warm heaviness of your ass on his lap. You smell like detergent – cotton-wool, springtime fresh. The damp rose-scent of your woman-skin long gone.

“What’s the matter?”

Your eyes are very, very bright – glittering in the semi-dark of his bedroom.

He wants to tell you many things. Wants to say a thousand different platitudes and thoughts: Everyone who loved me is gone and I don’t know why I’m here or what my purpose is. I’m useless. I’m old, rusted parts. I am alone.

“Am I here?” he asks instead, curling his thumb beneath your top and rubbing the silky skin of your back. “Am I with you?”

“Tony,” you say, blinking lightly, faint little lines around your pink mouth. “You’re with me and I’m with you and we are right here.”

“Am I real?”

You frown and it looks alarmingly like a small child – like a baby. “You’re as real as I am.”

But, you’re not real and his heart breaks in half. Fresh tears spring up from his eyes and you quickly wipe them away.

Because you were made for love and comfort – all those wires and pieces of hardware encased in so much soft skin. Tony needed his girl. He needed her.

He thinks of Steve. He thinks of Natasha. He thinks of their horror when they had discovered it.

“You’re out of your mind,” Steve tells him when he comes upon the machine in Tony’s lap.

A perfect copy of your head sits between his hands as he uses a screwdriver to tinker with the space inside your open neck (no more blood, or the white knob of bone that the real one had been left with). Your body lays silent on the table, spread out with your blue polished hands limp and quiet.

“She’s dead,” Natasha says softly – a little more kindly than Steve who is distraught. “I know you miss her but, this is no way to deal with it. It’s unhealthy, Tony.”

He ignores them – continues to criss-cross wires and make your eyes spark. When the lids open and stare up at him, Steve moans then stumbles out the door.

“I think I’m gonna be sick.”

Natasha shakes her head. She leaves him, too.

Here in the safe, wonderful space of his bedroom, you smile at him again – lashes fluttering like thin black pen strokes upon your warm cheek. For a moment, he can believe it’s you – the very real you alive and well and not dead in the ground without your pretty little head.

“You are real,” Tony mutters before leaning forward and kissing you. Your tongue tastes like chemicals and tart cherries, the teeth tiny and precise. You make a noise that could be a breath and your fingers come up to cling to his tattered sleeping shirt.

He gets you on your back – feels your strong arms wrap around his shoulders. They’re fierce enough to shove the air form his lungs. His powerful girl who he had always thought would live – the bravest of them – and he had spurned you and you’d been slaughtered.

You kiss him back – tongue and lips moving clear and concise. He uses lube from the night stand – plunges slick fingers into the opening inside you. The perfect cunt and he would never know yours.

No - he never got the chance.

There’s a jolt in his belly as he enters it – a feeling like being stabbed and redefined. He pushes the hair off its head, drops kisses on its gorgeous face. He tears the pajama pants from its legs and ruts into it fast and loose. Its ankles crossed at his back and holding him swiftly to it. All the while it smiles as he clings to the torso – as he fucks it and spills out all of his secrets against its artificial baby skin.

I always always loved you. I know I never acted on it but, I was scared and you were young and I loved you more than all the others.

I’ll never forgive myself. I’ll never forget. It should have been me.

“You’re so silly, Tony,” it giggles, brushing his hair from his eyes as he continues to take it in rough, short strokes. “There’s no need to be sorry.”

It moans – sweet and lyrical. It matches you perfectly down to the last freckle. You press a palm between his thighs, squeeze his cock where it’s half buried inside it.

“I’m right here, baby,” it croons and Tony believes.

**

title: How Could They Move Forward?
body:
by Gottoomanyships

I don’t even know what this is. I wrote it as a Stony Rp prompt and it kind of got away from me. No Beta. All mistakes are mine. Rating will eventually change

Sixteen hours. Forty-five minutes. Fifteen Seconds. The suit was busted. His body felt like lead. The only thing that hurt worse was the fact that Steve had chosen Bucky over him. Steve, who Tony had trusted and relied on as a team member, as… more, sometimes. And yet here he was. Stranded in a tin can on some mountain in Siberia. It was… it felt like the ultimate betrayal. He had known, all those years. How could Rogers even look Tony in the face? Tony couldn’t tell if the ache that radiated in his chest was from the new knowledge he’d acquired or from where Captain Rogers had lodged that vibranium dinner plate into his body. Sixteen hours. Forty-five minutes. Fifteen seconds. That’s how long it took for the team to finally find him, well what was left of it anyway.
Fast forward two years, the rest of the team finally received a pardon now that they are required to be together for another big mission. Tony is… on edge, to say the least. Even after that last-ditch effort to save whatever had been there between them, Tony hadn’t forgiven Rogers at all

summary: How to roast beans and caffeinate people
title: How to roast beans and caffeinate people
body:
by Kateyfish (014469)

Steve lifted the card reader so that it touched Tony’s card. There was a discreet beep and Steve withdrew the reader. Tony, lost in his phone, left his hand in the air so after staring at it for another long, puzzling moment, Steve took Tony’s wrist in his hand and pushed it back down to his side.

That got Tony’s attention. Tony looked up from the phone at his wrist, up at Steve’s hand, then back down at his wrist. When he spoke, it was while looking back down at his phone screen.

‘Huh. Don’t usually ask for a massage service with my coffee but if you’re so determined to manhandle me, you could at least make me a coffee before my happy ending?’

Steve blushed, both at the intimacy of the comment and the rudeness.

‘My coffee itself is a happy ending,’ Steve could not resist the urge to snap back. What was he doing? Was that flirting? Steve shook himself, remembered the horrific way that his first meeting with Stark all those years ago had ended, and stepped away to make the espresso, shaking his head as he stirred the frankly insane amount of sugar into the drink.

reblog.comment:
by Kateyfish (014469)

Steve lifted the card reader so that it touched Tony’s card. There was a discreet beep and Steve withdrew the reader. Tony, lost in his phone, left his hand in the air so after staring at it for another long, puzzling moment, Steve took Tony’s wrist in his hand and pushed it back down to his side.

That got Tony’s attention. Tony looked up from the phone at his wrist, up at Steve’s hand, then back down at his wrist. When he spoke, it was while looking back down at his phone screen.

‘Huh. Don’t usually ask for a massage service with my coffee but if you’re so determined to manhandle me, you could at least make me a coffee before my happy ending?’

Steve blushed, both at the intimacy of the comment and the rudeness.

‘My coffee itself is a happy ending,’ Steve could not resist the urge to snap back. What was he doing? Was that flirting? Steve shook himself, remembered the horrific way that his first meeting with Stark all those years ago had ended, and stepped away to make the espresso, shaking his head as he stirred the frankly insane amount of sugar into the drink.

title: On Thin Ice
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2IoYkw6

by Tilltheendwilliwrite

(world of Wings: ABO Fiction) Modern day AU (read the introduction - first of the world of wings series - for more info on this specific world)

Tony Stark, a Warlord Alpha and self-proclaimed genius, working his way through his fifth masters, is moderately happy with his rather unexciting life. He works, he creates, he helps where he can, but life started out hard, forcing him to create a shell that keeps everyone at bay. Only Rhodes, his best friend and beta, really understands him.

Then, fate takes a hand.

Fable Rogers, omega queen and tiny beauty, skates into his circle thanks to her hockey jock brother. When his inner beast sits up and howls MINE can Tony come to terms with the damage done to the one he would cherish above all others in time, or will the devil of her past roar into their lives and shred what could have been?
